Generation I.Red: An extremely rarely seen marine Pok é mon . Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: An extremely rarely seen marine Pok é mon . Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.
Generation I.Yellow: It is said that this Pok é mon lives somewhere in the sea and that it flies. However, it is only a rumor.
Generation I.Stadium: Has intelligence on par with people. This "sea guardian" is said to be capable of flying around the globe in about 16 hours.

Generation II.Gold: It is said that this Pok é mon constantly flies over the immense seas and rescues drowning people.
Generation II.Silver: This marine Pok é mon has an impressive build that lets it freely fly over raging seas without trouble.
Generation II.Crystal: It is said that somewhere in the ocean lies an island where these gather. Only they live there.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It is said that this Pok é mon constantly flies over the immense seas and rescues drowning people. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) This marine Pok é mon has an impressive build that lets it freely fly over raging seas without trouble. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Dragonite is capable of circling the globe in just sixteen hours. It is a kindhearted Pok é mon that leads lost and foundering ships in a storm to the safety of land.

Generation VII.Sun: This Pokémon saved a shipwrecked man, taking him to a remote island—a paradise occupied solely by Dragonite.
Generation VII.Moon: Incur the wrath of this normally calm Pokémon at your peril, because it will smash everything to smithereens before it's satisfied.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It flies over raging seas as if they were nothing. Observing this, a ship's captain dubbed this Pokémon "the sea incarnate."
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: You'll often hear tales of this kindhearted Pokémon rescuing people or Pokémon that are drowning.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: It is said that this Pokémon lives somewhere in the sea and that it flies. However, these are only rumors.

Generation VIII.Sword: It's a kindhearted Pokémon. If it spots a drowning person or Pokémon, Dragonite simply must help them.
Generation VIII.Shield: This Pokémon is known as the Sea Incarnate. Figureheads that resemble Dragonite decorate the bows of many ships.
